name: Pro Yaky? Super League '91
description:
Super League '91 is a baseball simulation game, and the sequel to Super League (a.k.a. Tommy Lasorda Baseball). The game plays much the same as its predecessor, and includes Pennant Race, Open (Exhibition), and All Pro game modes.

Unlike its predecessor, this version features an official NPB license, and thus includes all 12 Central and Pacific League teams, complete with player names and stats from the 1991 season.

A reworked version of the game that includes audio commentary and MLB teams was released internationally as Sports Talk Baseball.

shot.caption: Ah yes... '91 was an excellent year for baseball. Seibu Lions won the Japan Series, how fondly I remember that, despite my young age...
A couple of different modes to choose from.
Stadium select. Not much to choose from...
These choices should not be made lightly, they really affect the outcome.
One should also be careful while treading this part.
You really should. Standing still after a home run is the worst thing you can do... You gotta show your fans how HAPPY you feel inside. So RUN! Run like the crazy fucker you are!
Almost did it. Sorry guys, that was pretty unprofessional of me.
Why does it look like everyone's around a goddamn golf hole...
